column1: Local Foods////My wife ordered the Garden Veggie Sandwich with the bisque.  I ordered the Pastrami with Tuscan Kale and homegrown chips.   The Garden Veggie was excellent
column2: filled with large brussel sprouts and other veggie goodness.  My pastrami was sliced thin and packed in tightly to the sandwich
column3: but was unbelievably soft and tender.  The crunchiness of the cabbage served as a great contrast to the tenderness of the meat.  My only comment about the pastrami is that I'm not so used to seeing it so finely sliced
column4: love to get more of the "in your face" taste that I've grown to love.  Otherwise
column5: it's a solid sandwich.  The kale was fresh
column7: and great complement to the saltiness of the homegrown chips.
